title: Renault Chief Ousted, Enabling Carmaker to Move On From Ghosn Debacle
text:
Renault shares rose more than 4% on the Paris stock exchange after the ousting “with immediate effect” of chief executive Thierry Bolloré at a board meeting Friday morning. Chief financial officer Clotilde Delbos was appointed interim CEO.

The back story. According to French government sources, Bolloré’s firing was initiated by company chairman Jean-Dominique Senard with the support of the board representatives of the French state, which owns a 15% stake in the car maker and often calls the shots.

...
description: Renault CEO Bolloré denounces “coup” but firing pushed by French state will allow group to move on from Ghosn scandal.
